directions: In a kettle combine the lentils, the broth, the celery, the carrots, the tomatoes, the oil, the onion, the parsley, the pancetta, the garlic, the salt, the pepper, and 7 cups water, bring the mixture to a boil and simmer it, covered, skimming the froth, for 1 1/2 hours. Just before serving discard the pancetta if desired and stir in the lemon juice. Ladle the soup into bowls and sprinkle it with the Parmesan.
ingredients: 2 cups lentils, picked over and rinsed
1 1/2 cups drained and chopped canned tomatoes
1/4 pound pancetta (Italian cured pork belly, available at specialty food shops) or ham
title: Lentil Soup Kuppin
